definition: learned/erudite
extensive/ample/rich/obtain/aim/to win/to get/plentiful/to gamble
to learn/to study/to imitate/science/-ology
erudite and multi-talented (idiom); versatile and able

sentences.english: Learned before, a table personnel, optimistic, cheerful, witty humor.
sentences.chinese: 博學多才，一表人才，開朗樂觀，風趣幽默。

sentences.english: That didn't stop Chinese pundits from making a fuss over it.
sentences.chinese: 這並沒有阻止中國的博學之士對此大驚小怪。

sentences.english: Investigation proved him to be a man of deep and broad erudition.
sentences.chinese: 調查證明他是一位深且廣的博學。

sentences.english: He is very knowledgable and quite strict with us.
sentences.chinese: 他非常博學，而且對我們很嚴格。

sentences.english: He who does God's will and renounces his own is truly very learned.
sentences.chinese: 真正博學的人尊行上帝的旨意，丟棄自己的意思。

sentences.english: To create a mythology, you have to be an open book.
sentences.chinese: 要創造神話，你必須成爲一個博學多聞的人。

sentences.english: She's really clued up on politics.
sentences.chinese: 她對政治非常博學多聞。

sentences.english: And in public appearances he does not even try to disguise his erudition.
sentences.chinese: 在公開露面的場合，他也不刻意隱瞞他的博學多聞。

sentences.english: He is a man of wide information.
Our professor is Very abundance scholarly.
sentences.chinese: 咱們的教授非比尋常博學多聞。

sentences.english: Such erudition is greatly praised and honoured.
sentences.chinese: 這種博學是極受讚賞和尊重的。

sentences.english: They fancied themselves learned and assumed airs of erudition.
sentences.chinese: 他們自以爲有學問，擺出一副博學的樣子。

sentences.english: His erudition comes from his assiduous study.
sentences.chinese: 他的博學來自他的刻苦鑽研。

sentences.english: There was once a wise old woman who lived back in the hills.
sentences.chinese: 從前，有一位博學的老婦人，她住在後山。

sentences.english: And the third thing was that Michael was extremely well-read.
sentences.chinese: 第三件事是邁克爾是個相當博學的人。

definition: eager to study/studious/erudite
learning/knowledge/CL:個|个[ge4]
statecraft
Chinese national culture/studies of ancient Chinese civilization/the Imperial College (history)
worthy or virtuous person/honorific used for a person of the same or a younger generation
key information/instructions/it must be borne in mind
a sage/wise and holy man/virtuous ruler/Buddhist lama/wine
lit. to quote the classics/to quote chapter and verse (idiom)
the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经[Shi1 jing1] and the Book of History 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1]
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
conservative/reactionary
scholar/learned person
cultured/sophisticated
rude/rudely
to fast or abstain from meat, wine etc/vegetarian diet/study room/building/to give alms (to a monk)
